Package jtuple

Class BoundTuple

java.lang.Object
jtuple.BoundTuple
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>
public class BoundTuple
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
Represents a tuple whose elements type are bound to a given tuple schema. An instance of this class is a particular instance of a tuple schema.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static BoundTuple of​(TupleSchema tupleSchema, java.lang.Object... values)
      Creates a new BoundTuple object basing on the given schema
      Parameters:
      tupleSchema - the tuple schema to bound this tuple to
      values - the values associated to the attributes of the given tupleSchema, in the order they are represented.
      Returns:
      a new bound tuple

    • getSchema

      public TupleSchema getSchema()
      Gets the tupleSchema this BoundTuple is bound to.
      Returns:
      the tupleSchema of this BoundTuple.

    • asTuple

      public Tuple asTuple()
      Gets a tuple (untyped) representation of this BoundTuple.
      Returns:
      a tuple containing the values of this BoundTuple

    • get

      public <T> T get​(java.lang.String attribute, java.lang.Class<T> actualType) throws TupleSchemaException
      Gets the value that corresponds to the given attribute. This method allows to check the expected formal type at runtime, and to prevent supposed casual runtime errors due to dynamic type checking.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the return type of the value
      Parameters:
      attribute - the attribute to get the value of
      actualType - the expected actual type to compare with the formal type registered in the tupleSchema.
      Returns:
      the value that corresponds to the given attribute in this BoundTuple
      Throws:
      TupleSchemaException - If the attribute is not defined for the tupleSchema or the specified return type T is not the same of the type that corresponds to the requested attribute in the tupleSchema

    • get

      public <T> T get​(java.lang.String attribute) throws TupleSchemaException
      Gets the value that corresponds to the given attribute. This method do not check the actual type as long as the get(String, Class) method. If the given T type cannot be assigned to the formal parameter, invoking this method can cause a ClassCastException at runtime in some unexpected way, due to programming errors.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the return type of the value
      Parameters:
      attribute - the attribute to get the value of
      Returns:
      the value that corresponds to the given attribute in this BoundTuple
      Throws:
      TupleSchemaException - If the attribute is not defined for the tupleSchema
      java.lang.ClassCastException - If the specified return type T is not compatible with the type that corresponds to the requested attribute in the tupleSchema

    • get

      public <T> T get​(int index)
      Gets the value that corresponds to the given attribute. This method do not check the actual type as long as the get(String, Class) method. If the given T type cannot be assigned to the formal parameter, invoking this method can cause a ClassCastException at runtime in some unexpected way, due to programming errors.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the return type of the value
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the value to get
      Returns:
      the value that corresponds to the given attribute in this BoundTuple
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the attribute index is not defined for the tupleSchema

    • length

      public int length()
      Gets the number of values in this BoundTuple (i.e. the number of attributes of the TupleSchema this BoundTuple is bound to)
      Returns:
      the length of this BoundTuple
